text: The lymphotoxin promoter is stimulated by HTLV-I <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation of NF-kappa B in human T-cell lines .

The HTLV-I transcriptional activator <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was used to gain insight into the mechanism of lymphotoxin ( LT ; <extra_id_0> TNF-beta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene induction .
Tax - expressing cell lines produce LT biologic activity .

An LT promoter ( LT-293 ) <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> construct that contained an NF-kappa B site was active in the LT - producing C81-66-45 cell line , which contains defective HTLV-I but expresses <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

The observation that a mutated LT-kappa B construct ( M1 - <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) was inactive in C81-66-45 , confirmed the importance of NF-kappa B in LT gene expression .
<extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> was transfected into HTLV-I - negative human T-cell lines .
Jurkat T cells stably expressing <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> contained elevated levels of NF-kappa B that directly bound to the LT-kappa B site .

<extra_id_0> Tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> co-transfected with reporter constructs into Jurkat cells maximally activated HTLV-I-LTR - <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and kappa B - <extra_id_0> fos <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and also activated LT-293 to a lesser extent .

text: In JM T cells , <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induced LT-293 activity by two - to four-fold , though there was no induction of M1 - <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .
The increase in LT-293 <extra_id_0> CAT <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activity mirrored the increase in LT biologic activity seen under these conditions .

These studies , the first to demonstrate induction of LT promoter activity over basal levels , indicate that HTLV-I <extra_id_0> tax <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> causes low - level activation of both endogenous LT and the LT promoter , at least in part through activation of NF-kappa B .
